Title: Incident - Drowning
Content:
Time of incident

Was it in daylight

What injuries have been sustained

Where did the drowning incident take place?

Location of incident

Was a child involved?

If yes, was the child supervised at the time of the incident?

If the child was not supervised, where were the parents/guardians at the time of the incident

What is the swimming ability of the individual?

Is any cautionary advice given to customer in welcome meetings?

What warning signs are in place around the pool

Are clearly visible depth markings present?

Was a life guard on duty?

Is a trained life guard usually available on site?

What hours does the life guard work?

Are the hours displayed on signs around the pool?

Was the bottom of the pool clearly visible at the time of the incident?

Are there any raised area, hidden ledges, sudden depth changes within the pool?

If yes, are they highlighted in any way and how are they highlighted?

Were there any witnesses (not including members of your party) to the incident?

Have the witnesses been asked to supply a report?

What was the time lapse between the incident occurring and initial assistance being given?

Who called the doctor/ambulance?

Where did the doctor/ambulance come from?

What was the time lapse between the incident occurring and the doctor/ambulance arriving?

Name/address of doctor (where applicable)

Were there any organised activities taking place around the pool at the time of the incident?  If yes, please state what

Is resuscitation equipment available?  If yes, where is it located and what does it consist of?

Are any checks carried out on the equipment?  If yes, please state date of last check.

Are members of staff trained in CPR available when the pool is open?

Who is trained to use the equipment and what qualifications do they have?

Was anyone on duty at the time of the incident who was trained to use the resuscitation equipment?  Please provided details of the person(s)
Description: This article defines the type of Incidents that are considered for Customer Complaints/Enquiry

Title: Incident - Fire
Content:
Where did the fire start?

Was the fire alarm activated?

What time did the fire start?

Was there any delay in the fire alarm sounding?  If yes, why?

Were the fire brigade called?  If yes, has a copy of their report been requested?

Were the premises evacuated?  If yes, how long did this take?

Was fire fighting equipment used?  If yes, was it effective?

What time was the fire extinguished?

Did the fire or smoke spread beyond the original location of the fire?

Did hotel staff follow fire procedures?

What is the suspected cause of the fire?

What was the extent of the damage to the building?

Was there any structural damage to the building?

Were any customers hospitalised as a result of the fire?

Have there been any previous fires at this location that you are aware of?

What action have you/supplier taken in respect of this incident?

Has any customer complained/commented on the evacuation?
Description: This article defines the type of Fire Incidents that are considered for Customer Complaints/Enquiry

Title: Incident - Balcony
Content:
Time of incident

Was it daylight

Are there any general warning signs displayed around the hotel

What injuries have been sustained?

What floor did they fall from?

What is the height of the balcony where the incident occurred?

Weather conditions at time of incident

If the incident involved a child, were they being supervised by parents/guardians at the time?

If no, where were the parents/guardians?

What is the balcony made of (e.g. wood, metal, plastic etc)?  Please state and provided a description

Any there any excessive gaps/climb up opportunities on the balcony?

Are the gaps over 10cm

Is there a step-up?  If yes, what is the height

Are there any obvious structural hazards on the balcony

Are there any warning notices in place or advice given in welcome meetings?

Are there any slip/trip hazards on the balcony?

Was there any water on the balcony at the time of the incident?

Is there drainage for excess water on the balcony?

What was the time lapse between the incident occurring and medical attention being given

What had the customer been doing prior to the incident

Please upload photos of the balcony (from inside the room, from ground level, area where they landed and showing measurements of the height of the balcony and of any gaps)
Description: This article defines the balcony Incidents that are considered for Customer Complaints/Enquiry

Title: Incident - Glass
Content:
Time of incident

Was it daylight

What injuries have been sustained?

Where was the glass door?

How thick was the glass?

Were stickers present at adult height (1.5m)

Were stickers present at child height (0.8m)

If stickers were present but not at 0.8m or 1.5m, what height were they?

Was the glass broken?

Has a piece of glass been obtained?

Were any issue reported with the shower/ balcony doors/glass prior to the incident?

Have other shower/balconies doors/doors in public areas been checked to ensure glass is held securely in frames?

If curtains or blinds are present, were they open at the time of the incident?

Is the glass tinted?

Pictures required of doors
Description: This article defines the Glass Incidents that are considered for Customer Complaints/Enquiry

Title: Incident - Land Transport
Content:
Time of incident

Was it daylight

What is the name of the Transport Supplier

Was the transport provided as part of an Excursion?  If yes, please provide the name of the excursion

Was the excursion sold by Thomas Cook?

If the excursion was not sold by Thomas Cook, is it advertised in the accommodation?

If advertised in the accommodation, is it operated by the hotel or by an independent supplier?

If an independent supplier, does the hotel have a contract with them allowing them to sell in the complex?

Has the excursion been audited?

Please provide copies of all literature used to advertise the excursion

Did the incident occur on a jeep safari?

Were seat belts fitted to the jeep?

If so, were guests wearing them at the time of the incident?

Are guests advised to wear seat belts by the supplier and by way of notices inside the jeep?

What warnings/safety briefings are given prior to the trip taking place?

If there are any additional activities that guests may participate in, are they included in the cost of the excursion?

Was there a coach involved?

Where were the customer being taken from and to

How many customers were involved in the incident?

Were police called to the scene?  If yes, please obtain copies of police reports (translated locally if possible)

Number of guests on board and their booking references (attach separate list if necessary)

Were any guests injured?

If yes, please provide names and details of injuries sustained (attached separate list if necessary)

Please provide details of the transport providers insurance company

Have the owners/management of the transport provided been informed of the incident?

Could the incident have been caused by mechanical failure of any description?

Is the road on which the accident occurred prone to accidents?

What is the general condition of the road?

What speed was the vehicle travelling at, at the time of the incident?

What is the speed limited in the area where the incident occurred?

What was the weather like?

Were seat belts fitted to the risk seats?

Were the seat belts in full working order?

How long had the driver been driving for before the incident happened?

Has the driver been involved in any similar incident with either his present or past employers?

When did the vehicle last have a maintenance check?

If applicable, what date was the last government inspection (e.g. MOT or equivalent) carried out?

If customer were injured, which seats were they sitting on?

Was the driver making use of any mobile phone or radio equipment at the time of the incident?

If yes, please state what

Please provide details of the driver
Description: This Article defines the type of  Incident that are considered for Customer complaint

Title: Incident - Swimming Pool
Content:
Where did the incident occur? (please describe where around the pool

the incident happened and provide photos)

What is the alleged cause of this incident?

 

Broken/loose tiles

  • Are there any broken tiles in the swimming pool
  • If yes, is there any signage advising guests of this?
  • Are there any missing pool tiles?

 

Broken/loose pool grates

  • Does the grating appear to be securely fixed?
  • Is the grating made of plastic?
  • If no, please state material

 

Pool steps

  • Are the swimming pool steps securely fixed?
  • Do there appear to be any sharp or loose edges?
  • If yes, please state where

 

Pool lights

  • Do the pool lights appear to be in good working condition
  • Are there any exposed or loose wires?
  • Are there any missing/broken light covers?

 

Suction/entrapment

  • Is there an automatic shut off device fitted to the pool filter mechanism>
  • If yes, did it activate?
  • Were any filter covers missing/broken?
  • How many inlets/outlets are there in the pool? (please state number)
  • To your knowledge, was the filtration system functioning correctly at the time of the incident?
  • Was a lifeguard on duty at the time of the incident?

 

Has the incident been brought to the attention of the supplier?

If yes, have they agreed to repair/replace any missing/broken tiles/grates/lights

If yes, when will this be done?
Description: This article defines the general Swimming pool incident that are considered for customer complaints/enquiry

Title: Incident - Slip/Fall/Trip
Content:
Did the incident involve steps or stairs? (location)

  • Is there a handrail present?  If yes, is it on both sides?
  • Are there non slip grips/treads on the steps?
  • How wide are the steps?
  • What is the depth of the steps (measure from front to back)
  • What is the height of the step? (measure from top of step to bottom of step below)
  • Do the stairs form part of a fire exit?
  • Are the steps clearly highlighted?

Did the incident occur in toilets? (location)

  • How often are the toilets cleaned/checked?
  • Who is responsible for cleaning/checking them?
  • Have there been any reports of toilets leaking?
  • If yes, had any action been taken to resolve this?
  • Are there any toilet cleaning/maintenance logs?  If yes, please provide copies
  • When were the toilets last checked prior to the incident?

Did the incident occur around a swimming pool? (location)

  • If the pool surround is painted or tiled please provide details of the paint/tiles used and the manufacturer
  • Are glasses allowed around the pool area?
  • Are depth markings present?
  • How often is the pool checked for defects?
  • Who checks the pool for defects?
  • Are there any defective fixtures (e.g. light fittings, broken pool grates) that could have caused the incident?
  • Are the stairs into the pool defective in any way?  If yes, please state now

Did the incident occur elsewhere around the property/excursion venue? (location)

 

Time of incident

What injuries have been sustained?

What is the surface type where the incident occurred?

Does the surface appear to be non-slip?

Is the surface in good condition e.g. no chips, cracks, crumbling etc.

Was the area wet?

If yes, it is known there the liquid came from?  If so, please provide details

Are there any general warning signs displayed around the hotel?

Are wet floor signs used?

Had it been raining prior to the incident?

Does the hotel have a process for cleaning pathways/steps/public areas/pool areas of excess water?

Is the area where the incident occurred indoors or outdoors?

Please describe location of incident (and provide photos)

How often is the area cleaned?

Are there any slip/trip hazards present?

If yes, please state what

What was the customer wearing on their feet at the time of the incident?

If the surface was wet at the time of the incident, please answer the following questions:

  • If the area lit at night
  • Is the lighting adequate?
  • Was the lighting defective in any way?  If yes, please state why
  • What time are the light switched on?
  • Are the lights on a timer?
  • If yes, how long do they remain on for?
Description: This article defines the incidents that are considered for customer complaint/Enquiry
